documentation.text: @dev The Liquidations contract for a Dealer allows to liquidate undercollateralized positions in a reverse Dutch auction.
@dev Disables buying at liquidations. To be called only when Treasury shuts down.

documentation.text: @dev Liquidates a position. The caller pays the debt of `from`, and `buyer` receives an amount of collateral.
@dev Return price of a collateral unit, in dai, at the present moment, for a given user

devdoc.details: The Liquidations contract for a Dealer allows to liquidate undercollateralized positions in a reverse Dutch auction.

buy(bytes32,address,address,uint256).details: Liquidates a position. The caller pays the debt of `from`, and `buyer` receives an amount of collateral.

liquidate(bytes32,address).details: Starts a liquidation process for a given collateral and user.

orchestrate(address).details: Add user to the authorized users list

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

price(bytes32,address).details: Return price of a collateral unit, in dai, at the present moment, for a given user

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

shutdown().details: Disables buying at liquidations. To be called only when Treasury shuts down.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.
